newsitem.title: GERMANY: Traub says bankruptcy proceedings start.
newsitem.headline: Traub says bankruptcy proceedings start.

text.p: German machine tool-maker Traub AG said on Tuesday bankruptcy proceedings had been initiated, as it had previously indicated was likely following the failure of efforts to scale back debt with creditors.
Traub said in a statement that takeover offers would be considered from Gildemeister AG and Index, two firms that have expressed an interest in the business.
Shares in Traub were earlier suspended by the Stuttgart stock exchange, a move that the Frankfurt bourse said also applied to its market.
